dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Kicking off the show, uh, some pretty wild news from the markets today, right, Host_B?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kicking off the show, uh, some pretty wild news from the markets today, right, Host_B?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely, Host_A. I mean, we saw global stocks just *surge* today, like, really unexpected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely, Host_A. I mean, we saw global stocks just surge today, like, really unexpected.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global stocks plunged after crude oil posted its biggest fall since the 1991 Gulf War after Saudi Arabia launched a price war with Russia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Unexpected is an understatement! It's all thanks to this massive, *massive* jump in crude oil prices, apparently the biggest since the 1991 Gulf War.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unexpected is an understatement! It's all thanks to this massive, massive jump in crude oil prices, apparently the biggest since the nineteen ninety one Gulf War.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global stocks plunged after crude oil posted its biggest fall since the 1991 Gulf War after Saudi Arabia launched a price war with Russia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it was, um, a real turnaround. You look at Asia – Nikkei up over 5%, Hong Kong, mainland China also climbing. Investors just... they got emboldened.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it was, um, a real turnaround. You look at Asia - Nikkei up over five percent, Hong Kong, mainland China also climbing. Investors just... they got emboldened.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Japans Nikkei index fell more than 5% on Monday, while stocks in Hong Kong and mainland China were also down as panicked investors in Asia flocked to safe-haven assets like government bonds and the Japanese yen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And Europe followed suit! I mean, London's FTSE 100 up almost 8% this morning, France's CAC 40 over 7%, Germany's DAX, like, six percent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Europe followed suit! I mean, London's F T S E one hundred up almost eight percent this morning, France's C A C forty over seven percent, Germany's D A X, like, six percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: European stocks followed suit, with Londons FTSE 100 index down almost 8% on Monday morning, Frances CAC 40 more than 7% and Germanys DAX 6%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Even the Euro Stoxx 50, which covers the big European companies, saw its best performance in over a year, up more than 6%. And US futures? Sharply up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even the Euro Stoxx fifty, which covers the big European companies, saw its best performance in over a year, up more than six percent. And U S futures? Sharply up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The pan-European Euro Stoxx 50, measuring the Continent's 50 largest companies, plunged more than 6% on Monday morning, its worst performance in more than a year. U.S. futures were sharply down, with S&P 500 futures down more than 5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. So, the oil itself – Brent crude jumped to $33.20 a barrel, West Texas Intermediate, uh, a whopping 31% to $28.32. What triggered that, Host_B?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. So, the oil itself - Brent crude jumped to thirty three point two zero dollars a barrel, West Texas Intermediate, uh, a whopping thirty one percent to twenty eight point three two dollars. What triggered that, Host_B?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Oil prices plummeted with the benchmark Brent crude down to $33.20 a barrel, while West Texas Intermediate fell 31%, to $28.32 a barrel on Sunday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, Saudi Arabia announced it's gonna curtail production. This came after, you know, that OPEC deal with Russia fell apart last Friday. That's, that's what sparked it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Saudi Arabia announced it's gonna curtail production. This came after, you know, that O P E C deal with Russia fell apart last Friday. That's, that's what sparked it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The steep drop was triggered after Saudi Arabia announced it would raise production after OPEC's deal with Russia to supply collapsed on Friday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And the impact was huge globally. Australia, for example, added like, 90 billion US dollars to its markets. Best performance since the financial crisis.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And the impact was huge globally. Australia, for example, added like, ninety billion U S dollars to its markets. Best performance since the financial crisis.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some $90 billion ($140 billion AUD) was wiped off Australias markets on Monday, with the benchmark ASX falling more than 7%its worst performance since the global financial crash.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the ASX improved over 7%. [overlaps] It's massive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the A S X improved over seven percent. It's massive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some $90 billion ($140 billion AUD) was wiped off Australias markets on Monday, with the benchmark ASX falling more than 7%its worst performance since the global financial crash.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Massive. I mean, Goldman Sachs even warned that oil prices *could* hit $500 a barrel if the coronavirus completely disappears and the oil price war ends.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Massive. I mean, Goldman Sachs even warned that oil prices could hit five hundred dollars a barrel if the coronavirus completely disappears and the oil price war ends.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Oil prices could drop to a low of $20 a barrel, Goldman Sachs analysts warned on Sunday, if the coronavirus continues to spread and the oil price war intensifies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which, uh, I guess, you know, is a big *if* right now. But it does show you the potential.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, uh, I guess, you know, is a big if right now. But it does show you the potential.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It does. It does. And this is against a backdrop of some of the best gains we've seen since, what, the 2008-2011 financial crisis?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It does. It does. And this is against a backdrop of some of the best gains we've seen since, what, the two thousand eight to twenty eleven financial crisis?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global markets have posted some of their steepest falls since the 2008-2011 financial crisis with panicked moves from investors spooked by the potential impact of the coronavirus on the global economy, and an oil price war.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Investors are, like, feeling a bit more reassured, despite, you know, the ongoing global economic stuff. We're now looking at G7 for some action too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Investors are, like, feeling a bit more reassured, despite, you know, the ongoing global economic stuff. We're now looking at G seven for some action too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global markets have posted some of their steepest falls since the 2008-2011 financial crisis with panicked moves from investors spooked by the potential impact of the coronavirus on the global economy... which now will look for coordinated action from the G7 club of advanced economies to underpin the global economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the Fed's emergency rate cut didn't quite do the trick back then, so, um, all eyes on the G7 to really, you know, underpin things.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the Fed's emergency rate cut didn't quite do the trick back then, so, um, all eyes on the G seven to really, you know, underpin things.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Federal Reserves emergency rate on March 3, 2020, provided a momentary confidence boost for the markets, which now will look for coordinated action from the G7 club of advanced economies to underpin the global economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's, it's quite a dynamic situation, that's for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's, it's quite a dynamic situation, that's for sure.
